data.title: Make cmd+k clear terminal on Mac
Add Markdown Preview Right Click Copy Context Menu
data.body:
Issue #12034

**Bug**
There are no right click context menus in the markdown preview. Copying text using command-c still works, but you cannot access the copy context menu.

**Fix**
Add some JS to handle right clicks in the markdown preview. Show an electron menu on click and provide an option to copy text using builtin logic.

![nov-22-2016 17-37-54](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12821956/20548681/53469a4e-b0da-11e6-9d66-a756274fe208.gif)

closes #12034

data.title: React/JSX bracket formatting
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.2
- OS Version: OSX 10.11.6

Remove extra space space in inline javascript for brackets `}}`

Actual:
```javascript
<input ref={(ref) => { this.inputref = ref; } } />
```

Expected:
```javascript
<input ref={(ref) => { this.inputref = ref; }} />
```

data.title: VS Code Install While Windows Firewall Enabled Causes "CreateProcess failed; code 216"

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.2
- OS Version: Windows 10 10586.679

My experience:

1. Starting with non-working VSC 1.7.2 (code.exe gives "CreateProcess failed; code 216").
2. I uninstalled VSC.
3. I disabled the Windows Firewall.
4. I re-installed VSC.
5. Newly-installed VSC launches fine.
6. I re-enabled the Windows Firewall.
7. VSC still launches fine.
8. I uninstalled VSC.
9. I re-installed VSC (from exactly the same installer .exe used in Step 4) -- note that the firewall is still enabled at this time.
10. Newly-installed VSC does not work again (code.exe back to giving "CreateProcess failed; code 216").

At this point, note that I was also able to repeat Steps 1-5 to get back to a working VSC. The "breakage" or "non-breakage" of the installed code.exe, which is apparently dependent on the state of the Windows Firewall during installation, is completely repeatable for me at this time.

(I actually did the above cycle multiple times, until I convinced myself that simply turning the firewall on/off would break/not-break the installation.)

The Windows Firewall (when enabled) seems to affect VSC installation in some way that leaves code.exe unable to run.

Maybe the VS Code team and the Windows Firewall team need to have a chat?

data.title: Assume Jsx For Implicit TS Projects
data.body:
Issue #15814

**Bug**
1. Open a tsx file on its own.
2. See a error about passing `--jsx` to tsc.

**Fix**
For implicit projects, assume `"jsx": "preserve"`. I believe `preserve` is a safer assumption than `"jsx": "react"`, which will generate an error if `React` is not defined.

Closes #15814

data.title: Current editor behaviour promotes extraneous trailing whitespace
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.2
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Do anything that would cause trailing whitespace, such as deleting a newline when the following line contains only whitespace, or typing some characters, then some whitespace in preparation for the next word, but then changing your mind and moving the cursor elsewhere.
2. Go to another line, or press HOME to go back to the start of the current line.
3. With the cursor anywhere before the end of the original line, press END to jump back to the end, and start typing again.

**The END key jumps to the last non-whitespace character instead of the last character**. This makes sense for the HOME key, because you usually want to go to the start of the current line indentation, but the END key should not have this behaviour because (a) if you typed trailing whitespace deliberately, you probably want to keep it, and (b) if you did not type trailing whitespace deliberately, you probably want to get rid of it, which requires first knowing it's there. Yes, you can turn on hidden whitespace, but this doesn't change things, it just makes this friction more visible while editing.

Because the END key tricks you into thinking that the line has no trailing whitespace, you end up with a lot of lines with one, two or three trailing spaces as a result of making small edits to code. You then go to commit code to the repo only to realise there is a bunch of extraneous whitespace you didn't previously notice. This is also an annoyance when jumping around the code in other ways, as the previously-hidden whitespace gets in the way of edits and needs to be corrected.

I actually made [an extension](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=NathanRidley.autotrim) just to solve this and it currently has over 500 installs despite no promotion on my part, suggesting that others find this annoying too, and looked for an extension to solve the problem.

data.title: Include @types from typings
Toggling word wrap on markdown preview does nothing
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.1
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.1

Steps to Reproduce:

I have a markdown file with a really long command (curl output piped to a long `jq` filter, but could be anything) within a triple back-ticked code block. I can press Option-Z (or select from menu) in the editor to toggle word wrap like any text file. However, in markdown preview, toggling word wrap does nothing--I always have to scroll that single line to view all content.

I understand that Github still does not implement this behavior by default but there has been
[an old issue](https://github.com/github/markup/issues/168) tracking it, and while markdown rendering behavior is up to individual applications, it would be nice if VS Code could match word wrap toggle modes in both editing and preview.

data.title: Uncaught exception after rolling back 1.7.2 after install error -- cannot reinstall or open VSCode after roll back
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.71 attempting to upgrade to 1.7.2
- OS Version: Windows 7

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Setup was unable to automatically close all applications, even after restarting. No VSCode services are shown as running in task manager. https://i.imgur.com/K45W2Pk.png (this is from when I tried reinstalling after uninstalling vscode but is the same error)
1. Build failed while upgrading at copying over a file after choosing Ignore since the file is in use (this is from when I tried reinstalling after uninstalling vscode, but is the same error) https://i.imgur.com/wo5aADx.png
2.  Roll back changes
3. Attempt to open VSCode: https://i.imgur.com/13lrj2V.png
4. same issue on restarting


First I tried upgrading, second I restarted my PC, uninstalled VSCode, and tried to reinstall. Cannot open VScode.

data.title: Release notes opens a tab in every window.

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.1

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Run 1.7.1
2. Get upgrade message.
3. Click on "show release notes" button in banner.
4. "Code" menu -> "Restart".
5. Release notes is now open as a tab in every window.

I don't know if step 3 actually opened it in every window (I didn't check), or whether it was the restart in 4 that did it.

Also, it's a bit dubious that the banner disappears in step 3. I wanted to read the releases and then upgrade, but since the banner disappears, I have to go through the Code menu. Create separate issue?

data.title: Go to definition / Hovering and hinting seems to be broken in 1.7.2
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.7.2 (7ba55c5860b152d999dda59393ca3ebeb1b5c85f, 2016-11-21T22:01:10.756Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 15.6.0
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|html-snippets|abusaidm|0.0.18|
|githistory|donjayamanne|0.1.0|
|es6-angular-snips|kasperkeso|0.0.3|
|debugger-for-chrome|msjsdiag|2.2.2|
|debugger-for-ios-web|msjsdiag|0.1.2|
|whitespace|sandcastle|0.0.4|
|trailing-spaces|shardulm94|0.2.11|
|cordova-tools|vsmobile|1.2.3|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a simple function `function bar () {}`
2. Create a variable and assign it to the function `var foo = bar;`
3. Notice how right-clicking on bar and selecting `Go to definition` does not jump to the function
4. Notice how holding the `cmd` key over the assigned function doesn't highlight or show information about the function.

### Version 1.6 (Working)
![code1_6](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3903921/20540351/ed078b8e-b0c6-11e6-863a-ef1e24ddf8b5.gif)


### Version 1.7 (Not working)
![code1_7](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3903921/20540385/07f6fe8e-b0c7-11e6-92ea-3102c61850db.gif)

data.title: diffEditor.renderSideBySide is not loaded correctly while updating settings

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.0-Insiders
- OS Version: macOS

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a git project, make some changes, launch diff editor
2. Switch to inline view
3. Open user setting file
4. Change any random configuration, for example, `editor.lineNumbers`
5. The diff view is switched to sideBySide view immediately. From the right top dropdown menu, it's still saying `Switch to Side By Side view`

Expected:
If users don't change `diffEditor.renderSideBySide`, the diff view mode should change.

data.title: Ensure backup paths ignore case on windows and mac
data.body: Fixes #15862

data.title: Add ability to extend from other settings files
data.body:
Inspired by TSLint's ability to [extend](https://palantir.github.io/tslint/2016/03/31/sharable-configurations-rules.html) configuration files, it would be nice if `.vscode/settings.json` could behave the same way.

So if I have some global settings set up:

`~/example-repo/.vscode/my-company-settings.json`:
```json
{
  "editor.tabSize": 2,
  "editor.insertSpaces": true,
  "editor.formatOnSave": false
}
```

I can use them in another file, without having to duplicate the settings:

`~/example-repo/my-project/.vscode/settings.json`:
```json
{
  "extends": "../../.vscode/my-company-settings.json",
  "editor.formatOnSave": true,
  "editor.fontLigatures": true
}
```

And the computed settings for `~/example-repo/my-project/.vscode/settings.json` would be:

```json
{
  "editor.tabSize": 2,
  "editor.insertSpaces": true,
  "editor.formatOnSave": true,
  "editor.fontLigatures": true
}
```

data.title: Please integrate all emmet functionality
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. By default assign shortcut for popular emmet actions. For example: I love [emmet actions](http://docs.emmet.io/actions/). So after installing VS Code I had to assign shortkeys for these emmet actions manually
i. editor.emmet.action.wrapWithAbbreviation
ii.editor.emmet.action.updateTag
iii.editor.emmet.action.removeTag
iv.editor.emmet.action.balanceInward
v.editor.emmet.action.balanceOutward

2.  If all emmet action shortcuts can not be assigned then give us a handy option in menu bar for easy accessing of emmet actions. Previously I used Adobe brackets a lot. In 'Brackets' after installing emmet plugin a menu item called 'emmet' would appear. All emmet actions used to be listed under that menu. 

I hope you awesome guys will consider this issue. :) 
Thank you guys for this awesome VS Code program.
